basics.name: Solis Winters
basics.summary: A Health Policy PhD Candidate at UC Berkeley, with research interests in maternal and child health, HIV, causal inference, and impact evaluation

education.institution: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
education.courses: Graduate Certificate in Applied Data Science

education.institution: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
education.summary: Minors in Engineering Mathematics and Urban Poverty Studies
courses: Biostatistics Capstone: 'The black-white disparities in preterm birth rates in St. Louis City and County'
Honors Program Capstone: 'Understanding the role of social support among low food-secure adults in Missouri'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

professional research experience.name: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
professional research experience.summary: Lead data management, monitoring, and statistical analysis for a cluster randomized control trial to test whether cash incentives can improve treatment adherence among people living with HIV in Tanzania.

professional research experience.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
professional research experience.summary: Led the analysis for the impact evaluation of a nutrition randomized trial in Baja Verapaz, Guatemala and assisted with development of the manuscript.

professional research experience.name: University of California, San Francisco School of Nursing
professional research experience.summary: Wrote, updated, and revised R Markdown code to generate monthly, tailored reports based on customer feedback data for drug shop owners enrolled in a randomized controlled trial in Tanzania.

professional research experience.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
professional research experience.summary: Synthesized evidence around key questions for policymakers in the Philippines as they prepared to respond to challenges posed by COVID-19.

professional research experience.name: Inter-American Development Bank, Office of Strategic Planning and Development Effectiveness
professional research experience.summary: Provided technical support for impact evaluations and research in maternal and child health and nutrition.

professional research experience.name: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
professional research experience.summary: Interviewed parents for a qualitative research study to understand the relationship between sleep habits and health among young children in St. Louis.

professional research experience.name: American Institutes for Research
professional research experience.summary: Assisted in the evaluation of Plantwise Kenya, a project focused on improving plant health in Kenya by training extension agents and expanding farmer access to plant health information.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine
